Configure the display of WooPay buttons: Configure the display of WooPay buttons on your store.
Encrypt the public keys used in the chec: Encrypt the public keys used in the checkout form to harden your store against card testing attacks.
Link autofills your customers\u2019 paym: Link autofills your customers’ payment and shipping details to deliver an easy and seamless checkout experience. New payment experience (UPE) needs to be enabled for Link. By enabling this feature, you agree to the {{stripeLinkTerms}}Link by Stripe terms{{/stripeLinkTerms}}, and {{privacyPolicy}}Privacy Policy{{/privacyPolicy}}.
There has been an error capturing the pa: There has been an error capturing the payment for order #%s. Please try again later.
Funds are available for deposit %s busin: Funds are available for deposit %s business days after they’re received.
Your first deposit will be held for 7 da: Your first deposit will be held for 7 days. Deposit scheduling will be available after this period.
Deposit scheduling is currently unavaila: Deposit scheduling is currently unavailable for your store.
Deposits will occur every business day.
Deposits that fall on a holiday will ini: Deposits that fall on a holiday will initiate on the next business day.
Deposits scheduled on a weekend will be: Deposits scheduled on a weekend will be sent on the next business day.
Use a custom logo to WooPay if the one t: Use a custom logo to WooPay if the one taken from your store doesn’t look right. For best results, upload a high-resolution horizontal image with white or transparent background.
You must capture the payment on the orde: You must capture the payment on the order details screen within 7 days of authorisation, otherwise the money will return to the shopper.
Only cards support manual capture. When: Only cards support manual capture. When enabled, all other payment methods will be hidden from checkout.
Are you sure you want to enable manual c: Are you sure you want to enable manual capture of payments?
The following system status information: The following system status information will also be submitted:
Please provide additional details to hel: Please provide additional details to help us improve the experience
Can not load System Status Report: Can not load System Status Report
%s cannot be enabled at checkout. Click: %s cannot be enabled at checkout. Click to expand.

Allow your customers to collect payments: Allow your customers to collect payments via WooPay.

Configure the display of Apple Pay and G: Configure the display of Apple Pay and Google Pay buttons on your store.
Allow your customers to collect payments: Allow your customers to collect payments via Apple Pay and Google Pay.
Inform your customers about the return,: Inform your customers about the return, refund, and exchange policy, or include any other useful message. Note that you can add plain text and links, but not images.
When enabled, customers who have configu: When enabled, customers who have configured Apple Pay or Google Pay enabled devices will be able to pay with their respective choice of Wallet.
Error retrieving the active loan summary: Error retrieving the active loan summary.

The setting is not applied to In-Person: The setting is not applied to In-Person Payments (please note that In-Person Payments should be captured within 2 days of authorisation).
If you choose to continue, our payment p: If you choose to continue, our payment partner Stripe will send an e-mail to {{merchantEmail /}} to collect the required information
You need to provide more information to: You need to provide more information to enable %s on your checkout.
You need to provide more information to enable %s on your checkout:
%s won't be visible to your customers un: %s won't be visible to your customers until you provide the required information. Follow the instructions sent by our partner Stripe to %s.
This payment method is pending approval. Once approved, you will be able to use it.
To use %s, please contact WooCommerce su: To use %s, please contact WooCommerce support.
Allow customers to shop and pay in multi: Allow customers to shop and pay in multiple currencies. {{learnMoreLink}}Learn more{{/learnMoreLink}}

Expand your business with iDEAL \u2014 N: Expand your business with iDEAL — Netherlands’s most popular payment method.
Bancontact is a bank redirect payment me: Bancontact is a bank redirect payment method offered by more than 80% of online businesses in Belgium.
To preview the Apple Pay and Google Pay: To preview the buttons, ensure your device is configured to accept Apple Pay or Google Pay, and view this page using the Safari or Chrome browsers.
To preview the %1$s button, view this pa: To preview the %1$s button, view this page in the %2$s browser.
When enabled, users will be able to pay: When enabled, users will be able to pay with a saved card during checkout. Card details are stored in our platform, not on your store.
There was an error disabling the new pay: There was an error disabling the new payment methods.
Payment methods that require the new pay: Payment methods that require the new payments experience:
Without the new payments experience, you: Without the new payments experience, your customers will only be able to pay using credit card / debit card. You will not be able to add other sales-boosting payment methods anymore.

Update your store's configuration to ens: Update your store's configuration to ensure smooth transactions.
Charge must be captured on the order det: Charge must be captured on the order details screen within 7 days of authorisation, otherwise the authorisation and order will be canceled.
Let your customers use their favorite ex: Let your customers use their favourite express payment methods and digital wallets for faster, more secure checkouts across different parts of your store.
Add and edit payments available to custo: Add and edit payments available to customers at checkout. Based on their device type, location, and purchase history, your customers will only see the most relevant payment methods.
Use {{testCardHelpLink}}test card number: Use {{testCardHelpLink}}test card numbers{{/testCardHelpLink}} to simulate various transactions. {{learnMoreLink}}Learn more{{/learnMoreLink}}
You can add it again at any time in {{wo: You can add it again at any time in {{wooCommercePaymentsLink /}}
Are you sure you want to remove {{strong: Are you sure you want to remove {{strong}}%s{{/strong}}? Your customers will no longer be able to pay using %s.
When enabled, payment error logs will be: When enabled, payment error logs will be saved to WooCommerce > Status > Logs.
Issue an authorization on checkout, and: Issue an authorisation on checkout, and capture later
Reach 500 million customers and over 20: Reach 500 million customers and over 20 million businesses across the European Union.
Accept secure bank transfers from Austri: Accept secure bank transfers from Austria, Belgium, Germany, Italy, Netherlands, and Spain.
Expand your business with giropay \u2014: Expand your business with giropay — Germany’s second most popular payment system.
Let your customers pay with major credit: Let your customers pay with major credit and debit cards without leaving your store.
Edit the way your store name appears on: Edit the way your store name appears on your customers' bank statements.
There has been an error accepting the di: There has been an error accepting the dispute. Please try again later.
You have accepted the dispute for order: You have accepted the dispute for order #%s.
The customer doesn\u2019t recognize the: The customer doesn’t recognise the payment appearing on their card statement.
Otherwise, use the forms on the next scr: Otherwise, use the forms on the next screen to submit evidence that the subscription was still active and that the customer was aware of, and did not follow, your cancellation procedure.
First, get in touch with your customer. If you understand what they believe happened, there is a chance for you to explain the misunderstanding or to make it right.
First, try to get in touch with your cus: First, try to get in touch with your customer. Sometimes people forget about payments they make or don’t recognise the way they appear on their card statement. If this is the case, ask them to contact their card issuer and let them know they no longer dispute the transaction. Even if your customer agrees to withdraw the dispute, you must still submit appropriate evidence. Simply saying that your customer is going to withdraw the dispute is not sufficient evidence.
Prove that the subscription was still ac: Prove that the subscription was still active and that the customer was aware of, and did not follow, your cancellation procedure.
The customer claims that you continued t: The customer claims that you continued to charge them after a subscription was canceled.
If you can not prove the customer\u2019s: If you can not prove the customer’s subscription was canceled, and or they did not follow your cancelation policy, you should accept the dispute. You cannot issue a refund while a payment is being disputed. The credit card networks place liability for accepting disputed payments with you, the business.
If the customer withdraws their dispute: If the customer withdraws their dispute you should still submit evidence using the forms on the next screen. Be sure to provide a letter or email from the cardholder stating that they are no longer in dispute.
If your customer made no attempt to retu: If your customer made no attempt to return the product or cancel the service, or if you provided a replacement product or service, make sure to note that as well.
For products that have been repaired or: For products that have been repaired or replaced, provide evidence that the cardholder agreed to a repair or replacement, it has been received by the customer, and the repair or replacement has not since been disputed.
Demonstrate that the product or service: Demonstrate that the product or service was delivered as described at the time of purchase.
The product or service was received but: The product or service was received but was defective, damaged, or not as described.
If you can not prove the customer receiv: If you can not prove the customer received their product or service as described, you should accept the dispute. You cannot issue a refund while a payment is being disputed. The credit card networks place liability for accepting disputed payments with you, the business.
If the customer has not yet returned the: If the customer has not yet returned the product or canceled the service, provide specific information to that effect. You should double-check your incoming shipping records to verify that you have not received a return before you respond. If you have processed a credit or reversal for this transaction, provide evidence of this which includes the amount and date processed.
If the product or service is as describe: If the product or service is as described, provide specific information (invoice, contract, etc.) to refute the cardholder’s claims. Quality disputes are where the customer does not agree with the condition of merchandise or service received (e.g., a car repair situation or quality of a hotel room). There may be instances where you will need to obtain a neutral third-party opinion to help corroborate your claim against the cardholder. Provide as much specific information and documentation as possible to refute the cardholder’s claims. It is recommended that you address each point that the cardholder has made.
First, get in touch with your customer. Understanding why they filed the dispute will be important for helping make sure your customer gets the product and will give you critical information to prevent this from happening to others.
Prove that the customer received a physi: Prove that the customer received a physical product or offline service, or made use of a digital product or online service. This must have occurred prior to the date the dispute was initiated.
The customer claims they did not receive: The customer claims they did not receive the products or services purchased.
If you can not prove the customer receiv: If you can not prove the customer received their product or service, you should accept the dispute. You cannot issue a refund while a payment is being disputed. The credit card networks place liability for accepting disputed payments with you, the business.
This is an uncategorized dispute, so you: This is an uncategorised dispute, so you should contact the customer for additional details to find out why the payment was disputed.
Try to get in touch with your customer. Sometimes people forget about payments they make or don’t recognise the way they appear on their card statement. If this is the case, ask them to contact their card issuer and let them know they no longer dispute the transaction.
It may be more efficient\u2014and provid: It may be more efficient—and provide a better customer experience—to accept an accidental dispute and charge the customer again, if appropriate. Even when a dispute is withdrawn, it usually takes approximately 75 days to be finalised. Remember, it doesn’t matter to the card networks whether you win or lose a dispute; what matters is how many disputes a business receives, regardless of how many disputes are won.
Provide adequate payment and order detai: Provide adequate payment and order details so that a legitimate customer recognises it, or proves to the card issuer that their cardholder authorised the transaction.
Even if your customer agrees to withdraw: Even if your customer agrees to withdraw the dispute, you must still submit appropriate evidence using the forms on the next screen. Simply saying that your customer is going to withdraw the dispute is not sufficient evidence.
If there have been two or more separate: If there have been two or more separate payments, you should get in touch with your customer. If you understand what their complaint is, there is a chance for you to explain the misunderstanding or to make it right. If you’re able to resolve the issue with your customer, you can ask that they withdraw the dispute.
If they were not, collect any and all in: If they were not, collect any and all information documenting that each payment was made separately, such as copies of receipts. If the receipts don’t include the items purchased, be sure to include an itemised list. Each receipt should clearly indicate that the payments are for separate purchases of items or services. If you’ve been able to get in touch with the customer you should be sure to address any concerns they had in your evidence.
Determine if your customer was incorrect: Determine if your customer was incorrectly charged multiple times.
Demonstrate that each payment was for a: Demonstrate that each payment was for a separate product or service.
The customer claims they were charged mu: The customer claims they were charged multiple times for the same product or service.
If there were duplicate payments, you sh: If there were duplicate payments, you should accept the dispute. You cannot issue a refund while a payment is being disputed. The credit card networks place liability for accepting disputed payments with you, the business.
If the cardholder agrees to withdraw the: If the cardholder agrees to withdraw the dispute, you should still submit evidence for the dispute using the forms on the next screen. In addition to the following evidence, your submission should include correspondence with the cardholder saying they would withdraw the dispute and a written statement from their card issuer confirming that the dispute has been withdrawn.
You should first get in touch with your: You should first get in touch with your customer. If you understand what their complaint is, there is a chance for you to explain the misunderstanding or to make it right. If you’re able to resolve the issue with your customer, you can ask that they withdraw the dispute.
Demonstrate that you have refunded your: Demonstrate that you have refunded your customer through other means or that your customer is not entitled to a refund. You cannot issue a refund while a payment is being disputed. If you believe that your customer was entitled a refund that you did not provide, you can accept the dispute.
The customer claims that the purchased p: The customer claims that the purchased product was returned or the transaction was otherwise canceled, but you have not yet provided a refund or credit.
If your customer was not refunded approp: If your customer was not refunded appropriately, you will need to accept the dispute, or resolve the issue with your customer. The credit card networks place liability for accepting disputed payments with you, the business.
If you believe the dispute is invalid, y: If you believe the dispute is invalid, you can challenge it by submitting the appropriate evidence using the response forms on the next screen.
Dev mode is active so logging is on by d: Dev mode is active so logging is on by default.
Dev mode is active so all transactions w: Dev mode is active so all transactions will be in test mode. This setting is only available to live accounts.
